Hi!

Hi, I'm Johannes engineer by training, builder by nature, and entrepreneur by conviction. Over the past two decades, I've designed and scaled intelligent software systems across a wide range of domains from distributed energy infrastructure to smart cities, from AI in healthcare and sports to cloud platforms powering 100M+ in revenue.

I'm the and co-founder of JadeMind GmbH, a lean and independent software company I've been running with my friend Andreas for over 14 years. Together, we help organizations build purposeful, efficient, and long-lasting software with a deep respect for people, quality, and sustainability. We believe great software doesn't have to come with burnout or bloat.

Before that, I served as CIO and tech lead at neoom AG, Austria's leading cleantech company. I helped scale the team from 19 to nearly 300 and led the architecture of a platform now powering thousands of energy sites across Europe.

I hold a Ph.D. in Distributed Systems from TU Vienna, where I focused on smart city application ecosystems and received the Austrian Award of Excellence for my dissertation. My research has been published in leading journals and cited over 600 times. In 2022, I had the opportunity to share my thoughts on human-centered innovation in a TEDx talk titled "Small Changes, Big Systems."

Along the way, I've learned that what matters most isn't just what we build but how and why we build it. I'm passionate about creating tools and systems that support clarity, calm, and better ways of living and working as a founder, a father of two, and a human being navigating a complex world.

On Twitter and our blog, I share actionable insights on technology, entrepreneurship, health, and intentional living.

Want to connect or collaborate? I'm always open for meaningful conversations: me@jomis.net
